power_type.markdownDescription: Left side of the equation, and the resource that stores the result.Right side of the equation, and the resource that stores the value.

math_operator.description: The math operator you want to use. Can be "`add`", "`subtract`", "`multiply`", "`divide`", "`mod`", "`exponent`", or "`set`".
math_operator.markdownDescription: The math operator you want to use. Can be "`add`", "`subtract`", "`multiply`", "`divide`", "`mod`", "`exponent`", or "`set`".

x-intellij-html-description:
Resource Math

This action type allows to do math, from one resource onto another.

Fields

Field Type Default Description
power_type Power Type required Left side of the equation, and the resource that stores the result.
math_operator Math Operator required The math operator you want to use. Can be "add", "subtract", "multiply", "divide", "mod", "exponent", or "set".
power_type Power Type required Right side of the equation, and the resource that stores the value.

Example

{
  "type": "origins:multiple",
  "resource1": {
    "type": "origins:resource",
    "min": 0,
    "max": 100,
    "start_value": 1,
    "hud_render": {
      "sprite_location": "origins:textures/gui/community/spiderkolo/resource_bar_01.png",
      "bar_index": 2
    }
  },
  "resource2": {
    "type": "origins:resource",
    "min": 0,
    "max": 100,
    "start_value": 1,
    "hud_render": {
      "sprite_location": "origins:textures/gui/community/spiderkolo/resource_bar_01.png",
      "bar_index": 3
    }
  },
  "active1": {
    "type": "origins:active_self",
    "entity_action": {
      "type": "moborigins:resource_math",
      "to_resource": "*:*_resource1",
      "from_resource": "*:*_resource2",
      "operator": "add"
    }
  },
  "active2": {
    "type": "origins:active_self",
    "key": {
      "key": "key.origins.secondary_active"
    },
    "entity_action": {
      "type": "moborigins:resource_math",
      "to_resource": "*:*_resource2",
      "from_resource": "*:*_resource1",
      "operator": "add"
    }
  }
}

This power defines two resources, and allows using the primary active to add the value of the secondary resource to the primary resource, and the secondary active to add the value of the primary resource to the secondary resource.
